session_title: Teaching for Transfer
session_description: The Teaching for Transfer (TFT) curriculum includes three interlocking components: (1) key terms; (2) systematic reflection; and (3) studentsâ€™ Theory of Writing, articulated in a final assignment. Research demonstrates that in completing the course, students develop a knowledge of writing available for framing new writing tasks. In this Special Interest Group session, weâ€™ll introduce TFT quickly before breaking into small sessions addressing several issues, including misconceptions about TFT; TFT in FYC; TFT in upper-level writing courses; and specific adaptations to the TFT curriculum.

presenter_name: Hilton Ballroom of the Americas Salon B
session_title: Taking Action and Taking Responsibility: A Roundtable for Caucuses, Special Interest Groups, Standing Groups, and the NCTE/CCCC
session_description: This roundtable/conversation addresses institutional constraints that have led to a "siloing" rhetoric that frames caucuses as non-intersectional, discrete groups, while the label of "special" implies the broader organization is unmarked and white. What are our responsibilities to our caucuses and what responsibilities do the caucuses have to each other?
